alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 9:41AM EST until December 28 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Chester. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM EST, French Creek at Phoenixville was still above flood stage. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fell earlier. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - For French Creek at Phoenixville: At 8:30am the stage was 8.18 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. ... For Schuylkill River at Pottstown: At 8:15am the stage was 7.67 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
